items.title: Meta Saw TikTok as ‘Highly Urgent’ Threat, Zuckerberg Says at Antitrust Trial
items.description: (Bloomberg) -- Mark Zuckerberg, the first witness in the Federal Trade Commission’s trial to break up his social media empire, gave a rare window into how he makes business decisions: by fighting for survival, even when his company is ahead.Most Read from BloombergTrump Signs Executive Orders on Federal Purchasing, Office SpaceHow Did This Suburb Figure Out Mass Transit?DOGE Places Entire Staff of Federal Homelessness Agency on LeaveWhy the Best Bike Lanes Always Get BlamedLA County Floats Leane

items.title: Microsoft Target Slashed to $472 as Demand Slips, but AI Bet Keeps Bulls Hopeful
items.description: Morgan Stanley cut Microsoft's price target to $472 from $530, maintaining its Overweight rating.

items.title: Why Microsoft Stock Tumbled 3.7% Today
items.description: Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT) had one of its more forgettable sessions on the stock market Wednesday, with its share price melting by 3.7% at closing time.  In an article published this morning and citing an unnamed "person familiar with the matter," Bloomberg wrote that leading artificial intelligence (AI) company OpenAI is in active talks to acquire another privately held AI business called Windsurf.  While OpenAI is a separate entity from Microsoft, the tech giant has invested considerably in the company.
